name: A demonstration meeting with Solid
goal: The purpose of this meeting is to show you how to run a productive and actionable meeting, with a little help from Solid.
agenda_html:
• Set the goal of the meeting
      • The goal of this demonstration meeting has been set by Solid earlier. It describes what needs to happen as a result of the meeting.
      • Try to edit it.
    • Set the agenda and take notes
      • The agenda lists all the topics of discussion for the meeting. Each one can contain notes like this one. Notes can also be tasks, decisions and open issues.
      • Create a new agenda item and add notes. Write down what you think Solid is for.
    • Keep an eye on the clock and end the meeting on time
      • This meeting is planned to last 30 minutes. The timer started automatically and displays the remaining time before the meeting is over.
      • Try to reset the timer if you want to start the meeting over.
      • Once you feel like the demonstration is over, end the meeting.
    • Wrap it up and share the summary
      • The key to successful meetings is to make sure that every one of the meeting's participants gets away with an actionable summary of the meeting.
      • Once you've ended the meeting, share the summary.
      • This is how Solid can be used every time to run your meetings.
agenda_markdown:
## Set the goal of the meeting
  - The goal of this demonstration meeting has been set by Solid earlier. It describes what needs to happen as a result of the meeting.
  - Try to edit it.
## Set the agenda and take notes
  - The agenda lists all the topics of discussion for the meeting. Each one can contain notes like this one. Notes can also be tasks, decisions and open issues.
  - Create a new agenda item and add notes. Write down what you think Solid is for.
## Keep an eye on the clock and end the meeting on time
  - This meeting is planned to last 30 minutes. The timer started automatically and displays the remaining time before the meeting is over.
  - Try to reset the timer if you want to start the meeting over.
  - Once you feel like the demonstration is over, end the meeting.
## Wrap it up and share the summary
  - The key to successful meetings is to make sure that every one of the meeting's participants gets away with an actionable summary of the meeting.
  - Once you've ended the meeting, share the summary.
  - This is how Solid can be used every time to run your meetings.
